meanings.definition: A person who complains or expresses dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent1: The group of moaners in the office always find something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: The moaners at the meeting were not satisfied with the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The moaners in the movie theater kept whispering about the plot twists.
meanings.sent4: The team captain referred to the complainers as the 'moaners' of the group.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to stop being moaners and focus on their work.

meanings.definition: To make a low, mournful sound expressing pain or unhappiness.
meanings.sent1: The injured dog moaners softly as the vet examined its paw.
meanings.sent2: She moaners in discomfort as she tried to get up from the chair.
meanings.sent3: The old floorboards moaners under the weight of each step.
meanings.sent4: The wind moaners through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure moaners eerily in the abandoned house.
